official-title.#text: Supporting the goals and ideals of National Women’s History Month.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: supports the goals and ideals of National Women's History Month; and

recognizes and honors the women and organizations in the United States that have fought for and
			 continue to promote the teaching of women's history.

Whereas the purpose of National Women’s History Month is to increase awareness and knowledge of
			 women's involvement in history;

Whereas as recently as the 1970s, women’s history was rarely included in the kindergarten through
			 grade 12 curriculum and was not part of public awareness;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: passed a resolution making Women’s History Week a national observance;

text.#text: Whereas in 1981, responding to the growing popularity of women’s history celebrations,

Whereas during this time, using information provided by the National Women’s History Project,
			 founded in Sonoma County, California, thousands of schools and communities
			 joined in the commemoration of National Women's History Week, with support
			 and encouragement from governors, city councils, school boards, and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to expand the national
			 celebration to include the entire month of March;

text.#text: Whereas in 1987, the National Women’s History Project petitioned

Whereas educators, workplace program planners, parents, and community organizations in thousands of
			 communities in the United States under the guidance of the National
			 Women's History Project, have turned National Women’s History Month into a
			 major local learning experience and celebration;

Whereas the popularity of women’s history celebrations has sparked a new interest in uncovering
			 women’s forgotten heritage;

Whereas the National Women’s History Museum was founded in 1996 as an institution dedicated to
			 preserving, interpreting, and celebrating the diverse historic
			 contributions of women, and integrating this rich heritage fully into the
			 Nation’s teachings and history books;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: recognizes March 2014 as National Women’s History Month; and

text.#text:
Whereas the theme of National Women's History Month 2014 is “Women of Character, Courage, and
			 Commitment”: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 525 IH: Supporting the goals and ideals of National Women’s History Month.
